item.title: South Korean & Japanese leaders pledge stronger ties amid shifting global dynamics
item.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Japan’s new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on Thursday pledged to deepen bilateral relations despite lingering tensions rooted in their wartime history, as both countries navigate global uncertainty and pressure from the United States. The meeting, hel

item.title: Modhumoti Bank holds 139th meeting of Executive Committee
item.description: The 139th meeting of the Executive Committee of Modhumoti Bank PLC was held on Thursday, 30th October 2025, at the bank’s Head Office premises. The meeting was presided over by EC Chairman, Mr. Salahuddin Alamgir, according to a press release. Among others, Mr. Mostafa Kamal, Mr. Mohammad I

item.title: IFIC Bank holds awareness program on 'Prevention of Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing'
item.description: Under the guidance and cooperation of the Bangladesh Financial Intelligence Unit (BFIU), the country’s largest bank, IFIC Bank, organized an awareness program on "Prevention of Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing" for the senior officials of the bank. The Managing Director of the bank,

item.title: BSEC calls for stakeholder feedback on draft equity securities rules
item.description: The Bangladesh Securities and Exchange Commission (BSEC) has formally requested opinions, suggestions, or objections from relevant stakeholders concerning the draft 'Bangladesh Securities and Exchange Commission (Public Offer of Equity Securities) Rules, 2025'. The draft rules have already bee

item.title: More protests in Tanzania’s main city after chaotic election
item.description: Police in Tanzania fired tear gas and gunshots on Thursday to disperse groups of protesters who returned to the streets a day after a general election marred by violent demonstrations, witnesses said. Protests broke out in commercial capital Dar es Salaam and other cities during the vote on Wednes

item.title: Woman hacked by ‘stepson’ in Cumilla dies
item.description: A woman, who was allegedly hacked by her stepson at Sabdalpur village in Chandina upazila of Cumilla on Wednesday night, died in Dhaka on Thursday. The victim is Halima Khatun, 34, second wife of Emdadul Haque Munshi, UNB reports. According to locals, Emdadul, 75 lost his first wife about t

item.title: DMTCL to offer job to widow of man killed in metro bearing pad accident
item.description: Dhaka Mass Transit Company Limited (DMTCL) is giving a job to the wife of Abul Kalam, who died in Farmgate after a bearing pad from the metro rail fell on him. DMTCL Managing Director Faruque Ahmed said on Thursday that they are making efforts to arrange a position for Kalam’s wife Irene Akh

item.title: Travel ban on 9 foreigners over ‘embezzlement’
item.description: A Dhaka court has barred nine foreign nationals, including five founding directors of Ring Shine Textiles Limited, from leaving the country over allegations of embezzling Tk 2.75 billion. They allegedly submitted falsified documents to list the Dhaka EPZ-based company on the capital market. Dhaka

item.title: Bangladesh’s remittance crosses $10b in FY’s first four months
item.description: The remittance inflow to Bangladesh has surpassed $10 billion in the first four months (July–October) of the 2025-26 fiscal year. According to information provided on Thursday by Bangladesh Bank’s Assistant Spokesperson Shahriar Siddiqui, the remittance inflow exceeded $10 billion with
